attributes.text:
A window widget

More information can be found in the package description {@link qx.ui.window}.
The URL of the caption bar icon

Fired before the window is closed.

The close action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

Fired before the window is maximize.

The maximize action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

Fired before the window is minimize.

The minimize action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

Fired before the window is restored from a minimized or maximized state.

The restored action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object
Fired on change of the property {@link #active}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #caption}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #icon}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #modal}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #status}.
Fired if the window is restored from a minimized or maximized state
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property active.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyActive}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property caption.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyCaption}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property showClose.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyCaptionBarChange}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property icon.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyIcon}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property showStatusbar.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyShowStatusbar}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property status.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyStatus}.
Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.
Maximizes the window or restores it if it is already maximized.
Closes the window, removes all states from the close button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).
Maximizes the window, removes all states from the maximize button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).
Minimizes the window, removes all states from the minimize button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).
Restores the window, removes all states from the restore button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).
Listens to the “focusout” event to deactivate the window (if the currently focused widget is not a child of the window)
Updates the status and the visibility of each element of the captionbar.

Centers the window to the parent.

This call works with the size of the parent widget and the size of the window as calculated in the last layout flush. It is best to call this method just after rendering the window in the “resize” event:

  win.addListenerOnce("resize", this.center, this);
Closes the current window instance. Technically calls the {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#hide} method.

Returns the (computed) value of the property active.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #active}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property allowClose.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowClose}.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowMinimize}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property caption.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #caption}.
The children container needed by the {@link qx.ui.core.MRemoteChildrenHandling} mixin

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property active with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #active}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property status with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #status}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property active equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #active}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property allowClose equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowClose}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property allowMaximize equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowMaximize}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property allowMinimize equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowMinimize}.

Return true if the window is in maximized state, but note that the window in maximized state could also be invisible, this is equivalent to minimized. So use the {@link qx.ui.window.Window#getMode} to get the window mode.
true if the window is maximized, false otherwise.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property modal equals true.

Set the window’s position relative to its parent

Resets the user value of the property active.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #active}.

Restore the window to “normal”, if it is “maximized” or “minimized”.

If the window is active, only one window in a single qx.ui.window.Manager could have set this to true at the same time.
Should the user have the ability to close the window
Should the user have the ability to maximize the window
Should the user have the ability to minimize the window
Should the window be modal (this disables minimize and maximize buttons)
